import pandas as pd

```{python}
def prob(S, value):
    if set(value).issubset(set(S)):
        return len(value)/len(S)
    else:
        return 0
```

```{python}
S = {'a','b','c','d','e','f'}

a = 'a'
z = 'z'

```

```{python}
prob(S,a)
```

## Beta Distribution PDF 

```{python}
from scipy.stats import beta
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

a, b = 2, 5 # beta dist. parameters 

x = np.linspace(0,1,1000) # generate x-axis values 

pdf = beta.pdf(x,a,b) # calculate the beta pdf 
pdf1 = beta.pdf(x,4,5)
pdf2 = beta.pdf(x, 5,6)

plt.figure(figsize=(6,8))
plt.plot(x,pdf, label=(f'beta a= {a}, b= {b}'))
plt.plot(x,pdf1, label=('beta a= 4, b=5'))
plt.plot(x,pdf2, label=('beta a=5,b=6'))
plt.title('pdf of the beta distribution')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('density')
plt.grid(True)
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```


## setting up a normal distribution for random sampling
```{python}
from scipy.stats import norm

mu, se, sd, se_sd = 10,2,3,1

mean = np.random.normal(mu,se)
std_dev = np.random.normal(sd,se_sd)

x = np.linspace(-10,30,1000)
pdf = norm.pdf(x,mean,std_dev)

n = 50 # number of samples

plt.figure(figsize=(6,8))
for i in range(n):
    mean = np.random.normal(mu,se)
    std_dev = np.random.normal(sd,se_sd)
    pdf = norm.pdf(x,mean,std_dev)
    plt.plot(x,pdf,label=(f'mean = {mean}, std dev = {std_dev}'))
plt.title(f'\nPDF of a Normal Distribution from {n} samples')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('density')
plt.grid('True')
plt.show()
```
